result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah A Barta

defendant.name: Barta, Jeremiah A
defendant.address: 2511 Golf Road, Apt 5, Eau Claire, WI 54701

records.addlTxt: Ck# 44355 mailed to defendant; refund cash bond

Conditions:
No contact with H.T. or H.T.'s residence.
No violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

(11:15 AM case called.) Defendant Jeremiah A Barta in court without counsel. Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court orders the warrant is quashed.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on November 9, 2022 at 3:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with H.T. or H.T.'s residence.
No violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

Case called at 11:44 AM.
Defendant Jeremiah A Barta not in court.  Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State notes the Defendant called today indicating that he does not have a driver's license and was already at work.
Warrant ordered.
